standard_metadata.standard_description: Draw (freehand, with ruler and protractor, and with technology) geometric shapes with given conditions. Focus on constructing triangles from three measures of angles or sides, noticing when the conditions determine a unique triangle, more than one triangle, or no triangle.

question.content: **Order the side lengths of the triangle from shortest to longest.**       *Note: Figure not necessarily drawn to scale.*

hints.content: **Key idea:** The longest side of a triangle is always opposite that triangle's largest angle.    Play around with the triangle below to verify this key idea.  [[☃ interactive-graph 1]]
Side $c$ is the longest side because it is opposite the largest angle.
Side $a$ is the shortest side because it is opposite the smallest angle.
The side lengths are ordered from shortest to longest:   | | | - | - | - $a$ | $b$ | $c$

question.content: **Order the angles of the triangle from smallest to largest.**       *Note: Figure not necessarily drawn to scale.*

hints.content: **Key idea:** The longest side of a triangle is always opposite that triangle's largest angle.    Play around with the triangle below to verify this key idea.  [[☃ interactive-graph 1]]
Angle $B$ is the largest angle because the longest side is opposite it.
Angle $A$ is the smallest angle because the shortest side is opposite it.
The angles are ordered from smallest to largest:   | |  - | - | - $A$ | $C$ | $B$
